docs.lead_paragraph: ZEST is given to Arbor Day tree planting by the fact that famous trees of long ago still flourish and engage popular interest, especially in Washington, where there are more historic trees than in any other city in the world. Visitors may still behold Washington's elm, Lincoln's European hornbeam, the tree spared by Senator Simon Cameron of Pennsylvania, the oak from the tomb of Confucius, and Senator John Jordan Crittenden's peace tree.

headline.main: ARBOR DAY FINDS OLD TREES LUSTY; Washington's Elm, Lincoln's Hornbeam, and the Oak From the Tomb of Confucius Still Flourish In Capital -- Other Famous Trees

headline.main: HOMES OF MANY ARE UNFIT HABITATIONS; Thousands of Dwelling Houses in City Are Fifty Years Old and Are Without Light.
